body.p:
Princeton Ky
Gov. Thos E,, Bramlett
Sir.

By the time this reaches you you will have seen accounts in the papers of the plundering this part of the country by bands of Guerrillas, this should not be. & if you will commission me to raise 60 men & you agree to mount them & supply me with the Henry rifle & other necessaries I pledge you that I will keep them out of Lyon Caldwell Hopkins Crittenden & Trigg Counties. I select the Henry rifle because with that it would require fewer men & consequently less expensive, if you think my offer worth attention let me hear from you.

Princeton Ky
May 5th 1864
Wilson R. L

To the Governor asking authority to recruit a company of 60 men to be mounted and armed with the Henry rifle. Says he could protect the counties Lyon, Caldwell Crittenden Hopkins and Trigg from guerrilla raids

L B No3 -- 1864 P. 293
Recd A. G. O. 9th May 1864
